title: Drawing, "The Red Room, Schloss Fischbach", ca. 1846
medium: Brush and watercolor, graphite on white paper
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Hildegard Fritz-Denneville, London
dimensions:
Old frame H x W x D: 36.8 x 43.2 x 2 cm (14 1/2  x 17 x 7/8 in.)
Sheet: 16.5 x 22.4 cm (6 1/2 x 8 13/16 in.)
description: Displaying a combination of Neo-Gothic and Jacobean styles, this red room reflects the influence of Karl-Friedrich Schinkel's design books that were available from the 1820's onward. Chairs, cabinets-on-stand, tables and a harpsichord are late Renaissance in style. Chandeliers are Neo-Gothic in the manner of A. W. Pugin. The upper panes of the windows are inset with heraldic motifs, and tasselled pelmets create a valance across the top. A central medallion and floral-and-leaf pattern comprise a carpet in the Neo-Classical style.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection
